did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, extensive grape breeding notes and notebooks, drawings of grape plants, drawings and sketches for wine labels for the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station, Geneva Cellars. Includes rootstock and grape information from the U.S., Georgia (in the former U.S.S.R.), France, and Germany. Information about his Hammondsport vineyard.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: George W. Remaily was a viticulturist, notably of winter hardy table grapes. He studied at Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts in 1933-35 and was known as a landscape artist before he was recognized as a viticulturist. In the 1960s he moved with his wife to Hammondsport N.Y. from Bucks County, Pa., in order to continue grape breeding experiments and to collaborate with staff at the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station in Geneva, N.Y. Over the course of his life and well into his 80s, he collected over 2000 cultivars on both his Pennsylvania and New York properties to use for his many crosses. The focus of his work was crossing Vinifera seedless table grapes varieties with native seedless varieties in order to create winter hardy seedless table grapes. This accomplishment was a first in viticulture. His vineyard had a large collection of American, Asian and European hybrids, comprising a collection of root stock used throughout the world. For many years, he was associated with the Experiment Station at Geneva, where a vast collection of his originations were evaluated, resulting in such named varieties as Einsett Seedless, Marquis (currently in Stark catalog), and Remaily Seedless. During his tenure with the station, as the leading authority on indigenous species, he was invited to write a paper for the United Nations defining grape germ plasm.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, extensive grape breeding notes and notebooks, drawings of grape plants, drawings and sketches for wine labels for the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station, Geneva Cellars. Includes rootstock and grape information from the U.S., Georgia (in the former U.S.S.R.), France, and Germany. Information about his Hammondsport vineyard. Many slides of grapes and vineyard as well.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State Agricultural Experiment Station.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: George W. Remaily papers, #6665. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

descgrp.p: Folder titles are often derived from original folder titles, though in some cases they are not descriptive of all the material in the folder. Original folder order has, for the most part, been maintained. Order seems somewhat random. In some cases no folder title or theme could be established these items are labeled as miscellaneous. Remaily reused many pieces of paper for notes so sometimes the fronts and backs of notes are not related.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Forms part of the Eastern Wine and Grape Archive. (EWGA)
See collection #6695 for a large photo of the Remaily Seedless grape.

Viticulture of Eastern North America - Einset
Anthocyans of Grape Juice and Wine
Particulate analysis of species of vitis
Items removed from books and list of books removed from collection.
"Trace Elements in the Soil" by Firman E. Bear
New York State Fruit Testing Association
Wine and grape articles and clippings
Grape information, some from H. C. Barrett
Computerized grape seedling records, germplasm collections
Remaily's wine tasting diary notebook. His notes about wines he tasted. Back has garden and temperature notes.
Designs for Geneva Experiment Station wine labels
Correspondence and labels from Geneva Cellars
Slide of George Remaily in front of his Hammondsport home
Miscellaneous recipes and cooking clippings, some by Bruce I. Reisch
Regulation of Sex Expression and Seed Development in Grapes with 2-Chloroethylphosphonic Acid by Remaily and Walter J. Kender
Joseph W. Adams correspondence, University of Pennsylvania
Correspondence, includes Nelson Shaulis, James N. Moore, Albert Koyama. Includes some notes, discussion of grapes, Remaily's health. Note from Remaily to NYSAES regarding John P. Watson's death.
"Classification of Fruiting Characteristics and Properties" by George Renaily
Department of Agriculture, vitis description, exploration
"Descriptions of Vitis Clones Imported from Bordeaux, France and Geilweilerhop, Federal Republic of Germany" by Geroge Remaily
"Wine Varieties Selected for Further Testing in New York" R. M. Pool, K. H. Kimball, J. P. Watson
Misc. grape growth, nutrition, breeding, patent, articles
Monographies des Hybrides Producteurs et Porte-Greffes by A. Galibert
"Les Vignes Sauvages Comme Sources de Genes Pour L'amerlioration" Max rives
H. C. Barrett and others grape breeding articles
Crittenden Farm and index by vineyard
Grape breeding Horticultural Research Institute of Ontario report
Wine labels, many with evaluations and tasting notes written on back
Wine, brochures, articles, Taylor wine reports
Correspondence Art Neff Brights Fine Canadian Wines
Eastern Grape Grower and Winery News correspondence
Misc. correspondence, F. H. Hasselbacher, Walter S. Taylor, F. S. de Villiers.
Misc. items, notes, plat descriptions, wine
Release of the Marquis grape Bruce Reisch
Buckingham Township Pennsylvania land use project comprehensive plan, includes maps, letter from Bess Abell at the White House, correspondence.
Plant Genetic Resources Newsletter, with article by Remaily "Diversity of North American Species of Vitis"
Misc. not grape related items articles, lists of quotes
Manuscript for the Maternal Home Triumphant or Song of the Virtous Female Spider misc. other material.
Scientific papers and journals on grape hybrids breeding genetics farming
New York State Agricultural Experiment Station bulletins, vinifera
Grape scientific articles, several by Barry L. Comeaux
International Symposium on Vine Breeding, speeches.
Pages from La Vigne a Grand Rendementby Ravat
Monographies des meilleurs hybrides de vignes
Vegetable Research Farm daily data, NYSAES Geneva
New York Agricultural Experiment Station letter from F.C. Stewart to Prof. Beach on seedless grapes
Report to the National Academy of Science on a Scientific Visit to Hungary and Poland by R. W. Robinson
Misc. non grape articles and clippings
Register of New Fruit and Nut Varieties, several catalogs from List 1 to List 21
Fruit Varieties and Horticultural Digest, several issues from
Misc. non grape ephemera, includes Flavor of Man William Penn Lecture by Jean Toomer, Foster Hall brochure, Philadelphia Orchestra program, book Physiocrates.
Misc. notebooks covering a variety of topics. Vineyard notebooks, folders of information, daily notes, wine tasting, etc.
Photographs and slides. Images mostly of grapes and grape vines, gardens, some photos of George Remaily and the area around his home.
